p: In summary, bi-weekly consumption of fish (especially fatty fish) remains a cornerstone of cardiovascular prevention and should provide an average of 500 mg/d of EPA and DHA [ 126, 127]. The use of EPA and DHA in secondary prevention does not currently rest on solid ground because of the aforementioned reasons; yet, given the scantiness of side effects, some patients could benefit from additional fish oil intake, and physicians should discuss its use with them [ 128].
